formattedAddress: 285 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 285 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: They were racist. They literally segregated us. The white kids were called the gifted and talented kids and they had way more opportunities than us. They got to do cooking and lots of art projects. They would bully me and call me a spic and the principal wouldn't do anything. This boy in my class kicked me and punched me everyday and she did nothing. My class was mostly Hispanic and black. And we didn't get to do much as the other classes. But I'm glad I'm out of there. In 4th grade i was sitting down and my teacher stuck her finger in my butt crack and picked up my pants. Some teachers were really nice to me but not all. I'm glad I'm out of there. Now I got 1 more year to finally finish high school.

originalText.text: Worst school ever. There are only two classes per grade and one is gifted and talented. The principal is very rude and so are most of the teachers. The school has no money. The gym is also considered the lobby and you are forced to wear ugly uniforms.

text.text: Worst school ever. There are only two classes per grade and one is gifted and talented. The principal is very rude and so are most of the teachers. The school has no money. The gym is also considered the lobby and you are forced to wear ugly uniforms.

originalText.text: There where really great teachers, and they taught me so much. I think that the GNT program was really great and we had great opportunities. The only bad thing was the uniforms but other than that it was good

best principal goes to Mr.Culot and Ms.Queves

And best libararian goes to Ms. Franklin

originalText.text: looking at the playground brings back memories from first grade... lily, maddie, if you are out there, you remember me, casey? we are in 5th grade now. i moved to staten island... i wish i could move back.but thos school is avarage!
